meanings.definition: A small monetary unit in India, equal to one hundredth of a rupee.
meanings.sent1: In India, you can buy candies for just one pice each.
meanings.sent2: I found a pice on the ground and used it to buy a sweet.
meanings.sent3: The pice rolled away, trying to escape from the coin purse.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a shiny pice, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The beggar's eyes lit up when I dropped a pice into his cup.

meanings.definition: A small fragment or piece of something.
meanings.sent1: She picked up every pice of the broken vase to glue it back together.
meanings.sent2: A pice of the puzzle was missing, making it impossible to complete.
meanings.sent3: The cat played with a pice of string, thinking it was a mouse.
meanings.sent4: His heart shattered into pices when she said goodbye.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully placed each pice of glass to create a beautiful mosaic.
